intro: Stellularia saxatilis, commonly known as the rock starflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the northeastern United States. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, hairy leaves and produces small, star-shaped white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in woodland or open areas. It is adapted to full sun to partial shade and is drought-tolerant once established. Stellularia saxatilis is part of the Onagraceae family, which includes other flowering plants with showy blooms.
